title: Workstream Abstraction
description:
## Design Document
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md

## Overview
Introduce a Workstream abstraction that decouples front-end session identity from Claude Code session identity. This enables context window clearing without creating new UI entries, simplifies queue management (queue manages workstreams, not Claude sessions), and hides Claude sessions as an implementation detail.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. User sees workstreams in session list, not Claude sessions
2. Clearing context keeps user in same workstream
3. Queue position preserved after clear
4. Workstream name persists through clears
5. Migration creates workstream wrappers for existing sessions
6. Recipes can request fresh context without UI disruption
7. Messages display from active Claude session only
8. Backward compatibility: legacy session_id prompts still work

title: Implement workstream state management module
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#backend-workstream-state-management

## Context
The workstream abstraction requires a new Clojure namespace to manage workstream state. This is the foundation for all backend workstream functionality - message handlers and migration logic depend on this module.

## Requirements
- [ ] Create `voice-code.workstream` namespace
- [ ] Implement `workstream-index` atom for in-memory state
- [ ] Implement persistence to `~/.voice-code/workstreams.edn`
- [ ] Implement CRUD operations: `create-workstream!`, `get-workstream`, `get-all-workstreams`, `update-workstream!`, `delete-workstream!`
- [ ] Implement session linking: `link-claude-session!`, `unlink-claude-session!`
- [ ] Implement `load-workstream-index!` for startup loading
- [ ] Add `format-timestamp` utility function

## Technical Approach
- Files to create: `backend/src/voice_code/workstream.clj`
- Data structure per workstream:
  ```clojure
  {:id "uuid"
   :name "string"
   :working-directory "path"
   :active-claude-session-id "uuid or nil"
   :queue-priority :normal
   :priority-order 0.0
   :created-at timestamp-ms
   :last-modified timestamp-ms}
  ```
- Use `swap!` for atomic updates
- Persist after every mutation

## Verification
- [ ] Unit tests for `create-workstream!` with default and custom names
- [ ] Unit tests for `link-claude-session!` and `unlink-claude-session!`
- [ ] Unit tests for `unlink-claude-session!` returning previous session ID
- [ ] Unit tests for persistence (save/load round-trip)
- [ ] Manual: Verify `~/.voice-code/workstreams.edn` is created and readable

## Acceptance Criteria
- Workstream state can be created, read, updated, deleted
- Claude sessions can be linked/unlinked from workstreams
- State persists across backend restarts

## Parallelization
Can be worked alongside: iOS CoreData schema task

title: Write integration tests for workstream lifecycle
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#integration-tests

## Context
Integration tests verify end-to-end workstream functionality across backend and iOS, including the 4 test scenarios from the design document.

## Requirements
- [ ] Test 1: Full workstream lifecycle
  - Create workstream → first prompt → clear context → second prompt
  - Verify workstream ID constant, two distinct Claude sessions
- [ ] Test 2: Migration of existing sessions
  - Create legacy session, start backend, verify workstream created
  - Send legacy resume_session_id prompt, verify workstream reused
- [ ] Test 3: Recipe with fresh context
  - Create workstream with active session
  - Start recipe with :fresh-context step
  - Verify context_cleared sent, new Claude session created
- [ ] Test 4: Backward compatibility
  - Send legacy new_session_id prompt, verify workstream auto-created
  - Send legacy resume_session_id prompt, verify same workstream used
  - Send workstream_id prompt to same workstream, verify interoperability

## Technical Approach
- Use WebSocket test client to send messages
- Verify responses match expected structure
- Check backend state after operations
- May require test fixtures for legacy session setup

## Verification
- [ ] All 4 integration test scenarios pass
- [ ] Tests can run in CI environment
- [ ] Tests clean up after themselves

## Acceptance Criteria
- All acceptance criteria verified through integration tests:
  1. User sees workstreams, not Claude sessions
  2. Clearing context keeps user in same workstream
  3. Queue position preserved after clear
  4. Workstream name persists through clears
  5. Migration creates workstream wrappers
  6. Recipes can request fresh context
  7. Messages display from active Claude session only
  8. Backward compatibility works

## Parallelization
Dependencies: All previous tasks (this is the final verification)

title: Add CDWorkstream CoreData entity and schema
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#ios-cdworkstream-entity
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#ios-coredata-schema-changes

## Context
iOS needs a new CoreData entity to represent workstreams. This is the iOS foundation - the sync manager and VoiceCodeClient updates depend on this entity existing.

## Requirements
- [ ] Create new CoreData model version (e.g., VoiceCode 3.xcdatamodel)
- [ ] Add CDWorkstream entity with all attributes from design
- [ ] Set up indexes for id (unique), workingDirectory, and queue queries
- [ ] Create `CDWorkstream.swift` with entity class
- [ ] Add computed properties: `hasActiveSession`, `isCleared`
- [ ] Add fetch request helpers: `fetchAllWorkstreams`, `fetchWorkstreams(workingDirectory:)`, `fetchWorkstream(id:)`, `fetchQueuedWorkstreams`
- [ ] Conform to `Identifiable` protocol
- [ ] Ensure lightweight migration is enabled in PersistenceController

## Technical Approach
- Files to create: `ios/VoiceCode/Models/CDWorkstream.swift`
- Files to modify: `VoiceCode.xcdatamodeld` (add new version)
- Entity attributes:
  | Attribute | Type | Optional |
  |-----------|------|----------|
  | id | UUID | No |
  | name | String | No |
  | workingDirectory | String | No |
  | activeClaudeSessionId | UUID | Yes |
  | queuePriority | String | No |
  | priorityOrder | Double | No |
  | createdAt | Date | No |
  | lastModified | Date | No |
  | messageCount | Integer 32 | No |
  | preview | String | Yes |
  | unreadCount | Integer 32 | No |
  | isInPriorityQueue | Boolean | No |
  | priorityQueuedAt | Date | Yes |

## Verification
- [ ] Schema compiles without errors
- [ ] Lightweight migration succeeds from previous version
- [ ] Fetch requests return expected results
- [ ] Manual: Create workstream in simulator, verify persistence

title: Implement workstream WebSocket message handlers
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#websocket-protocol-changes
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#backend-message-handler-integration

## Context
The backend needs new message handlers for workstream operations. These handlers use the workstream state management module to process client requests.

## Requirements
- [ ] Implement `handle-create-workstream` - creates workstream, sends `workstream_created`
- [ ] Implement `handle-clear-context` - unlinks Claude session, sends `context_cleared`
- [ ] Add `format-timestamp` utility if not in workstream module
- [ ] Register handlers in message dispatch (handle-message fn)
- [ ] Send `workstream_list` after `connected` response
- [ ] Send `workstream_updated` when workstream metadata changes

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj`
- Requires: `voice-code.workstream` namespace (from task 1)
- Message types to handle:
  - `create_workstream` → `workstream_created`
  - `clear_context` → `context_cleared`
- Error handling:
  - Missing workstream_id → error message
  - Missing working_directory (create) → error message
  - Workstream not found (clear) → error message
- Dependencies: Workstream state management module

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: `handle-create-workstream` creates workstream and sends confirmation
- [ ] Unit test: `handle-clear-context` unlinks session and returns previous ID

## Acceptance Criteria

- clear_context message unlinks Claude session and confirms
- Error messages returned for invalid requests
- workstream_list sent on connection

title: Implement WorkstreamSyncManager for iOS
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#ios-workstreamsyncmanager

## Context
iOS needs a sync manager to handle workstream-related WebSocket messages and update CoreData. This mirrors the pattern of SessionSyncManager but for workstreams.

## Requirements
- [ ] Create `WorkstreamSyncManager` class
- [ ] Implement `handleWorkstreamList(_:)` - upserts workstreams from backend list
- [ ] Implement `handleWorkstreamUpdated(_:)` - updates single workstream
- [ ] Implement `handleContextCleared(workstreamId:previousClaudeSessionId:)` - clears active session, deletes messages
- [ ] Implement `createWorkstream(workingDirectory:name:)` - local creation before backend sync
- [ ] Add `Notification.Name.workstreamListDidUpdate` notification
- [ ] Use background context for database operations
- [ ] All handlers must be async

## Technical Approach
- Files to create: `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/WorkstreamSyncManager.swift`
- Requires: CDWorkstream entity (from task 2)
- Pattern: Use `persistenceController.performBackgroundTask` for thread safety
- Message cleanup on clear: Use `NSBatchDeleteRequest` for efficiency
- Upsert logic: Fetch by ID, update if exists, create if not

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: `handleWorkstreamList` creates new workstreams
- [ ] Unit test: `handleWorkstreamList` updates existing workstreams
- [ ] Unit test: `handleContextCleared` sets activeClaudeSessionId to nil
- [ ] Unit test: `handleContextCleared` deletes messages for previous session
- [ ] Unit test: `handleContextCleared` with nil previousSessionId doesn't crash
- [ ] Manual: Connect to backend, verify workstream_list populates CoreData

## Acceptance Criteria
- Workstream list syncs from backend to CoreData
- Context cleared operation updates workstream and cleans up messages
- Local workstream creation works for optimistic UI

## Parallelization
Can be worked alongside: Backend message handlers task
Dependencies: CDWorkstream entity (task 2)

title: Update prompt handler to use workstream abstraction
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#modified-message-prompt
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#backward-compatibility-legacy-sessionid-prompts

## Context
The prompt handler needs to support workstream_id as the primary session identifier while maintaining backward compatibility with legacy session_id fields.

## Requirements
- [ ] Implement `handle-prompt-with-workstream` - new prompt flow using workstream_id
- [ ] Implement `handle-prompt-legacy` - backward compatibility for new_session_id/resume_session_id
- [ ] Implement `get-or-create-workstream-for-session!` - auto-create workstream wrapper for legacy sessions
- [ ] Implement unified `handle-prompt` - routes to workstream or legacy handler
- [ ] Generate new Claude session ID when workstream has no active session
- [ ] Link newly created Claude session to workstream
- [ ] Acquire session lock before Claude invocation
- [ ] Send `workstream_updated` after successful prompt

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj`
- Requires: `voice-code.workstream` namespace
- Prompt flow with workstream_id:
  1. Look up workstream
  2. If active_claude_session_id exists → resume
  3. If nil → generate new UUID, link to workstream, create new session
- Legacy flow:
  1. new_session_id → create workstream + link
  2. resume_session_id → find/create workstream, then delegate
- Session locking: Use existing `acquire-session-lock!` / `release-session-lock!`

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: Prompt with workstream_id creates new Claude session when none linked
- [ ] Unit test: Prompt with workstream_id resumes existing Claude session
- [ ] Unit test: Prompt with legacy new_session_id auto-creates workstream
- [ ] Unit test: Prompt with legacy resume_session_id finds existing workstream
- [ ] Unit test: Session lock acquired before Claude invocation
- [ ] Manual: Send prompt via WebSocket, verify Claude session linked to workstream

## Acceptance Criteria
- Prompts with workstream_id work correctly (new and resume)
- Legacy session_id prompts continue to work
- Claude sessions automatically linked to workstreams
- Backward compatibility: legacy session_id prompts still work

## Parallelization
Dependencies: Workstream state management module (task 1), Message handlers (task 3)

title: Implement session-to-workstream migration
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#migration-strategy
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#backend-migration

## Context
Existing Claude sessions need to be wrapped in workstreams during migration. This runs on backend startup and creates workstream wrappers for orphaned sessions.

## Requirements
- [ ] Implement `migrate-sessions-to-workstreams!` function
- [ ] Scan session-index for sessions without workstream-id
- [ ] Create workstream wrapper for each orphaned session
- [ ] Link Claude session to new workstream
- [ ] Update session metadata with workstream-id reference
- [ ] Save both indices after migration
- [ ] Call migration on backend startup (after loading indices)
- [ ] Log migration statistics

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/workstream.clj`, `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj`
- Migration logic:
  1. Get all sessions from session-index
  2. Filter to those without :workstream-id
  3. For each orphaned session:
     - Generate new workstream UUID
     - Create workstream with session's name/working-directory
     - Set active-claude-session-id to session ID
     - Update session metadata with workstream-id
  4. Save both indices
- Idempotent: Running multiple times creates no duplicates

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: Migration creates workstream for orphaned session
- [ ] Unit test: Migration preserves session name and working directory
- [ ] Unit test: Migration links Claude session to workstream
- [ ] Unit test: Running migration twice doesn't create duplicates
- [ ] Manual: Start backend with existing sessions, verify workstreams created

## Acceptance Criteria
- Migration creates workstream wrappers for existing sessions
- Existing sessions continue to work after migration
- Migration is idempotent

## Parallelization
Dependencies: Workstream state management module (task 1)

title: Integrate workstream abstraction with recipe system
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#recipe-integration
@docs/design/workstream-abstraction.md#modified-message-startrecipe

## Context
Recipes need to use workstream_id instead of session_id, and recipes that require fresh context should be able to clear and continue on the same workstream.

## Requirements
- [ ] Update `start_recipe` handler to accept workstream_id
- [ ] Implement `execute-recipe-step-with-fresh-context`
- [ ] Support `:fresh-context true` flag on recipe steps
- [ ] Clear context internally when recipe step requires it
- [ ] Notify client of context_cleared when recipe clears
- [ ] Continue recipe execution on new Claude session
- [ ] Maintain workstream identity through recipe execution

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj` (or recipe-specific namespace)
- Recipe step execution flow:
  1. Check if step has :fresh-context true
  2. If yes, call `unlink-claude-session!`
  3. Send `context_cleared` to client
  4. Execute step (will create new Claude session)
- Workstream ID remains constant throughout recipe

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: Recipe with fresh-context step clears and continues
- [ ] Unit test: Workstream ID unchanged after fresh context
- [ ] Unit test: New Claude session created for fresh context step
- [ ] Integration test: Full recipe execution with fresh context step
- [ ] Manual: Run recipe that clears context, verify workstream stays same

## Acceptance Criteria
- Recipes can request fresh context without UI disruption
- start_recipe accepts workstream_id
- Recipe execution maintains workstream identity

## Parallelization
Dependencies: Workstream state management (task 1), Message handlers (task 3), Prompt handler (task 5)
